metadata:
========
Series: NY.ADJ.ICTR.GN.ZS

Aggregationmethod: Weighted average
--------
Developmentrelevance: Gross savings is used as a starting point for calculating adjusted net savings. Adjusted net saving is an indicator of the sustainability of an economy.
--------
IndicatorName: Adjusted savings: gross savings (% of GNI)
--------
License_Type: CC BY-4.0
--------
License_URL: https://datacatalog.worldbank.org/public-licenses#cc-by
--------
Limitationsandexceptions: Because gross savings is calculated as a residual it includes errors, which may not be offsetting, in its components.
--------
Longdefinition: Gross savings are the difference between gross national income and public and private consumption, plus net current transfers.
--------
Periodicity: Annual
--------
Source: World Bank national accounts data files.
--------
Statisticalconceptandmethodology: Gross savings are calculated as a residual from the national accounts by taking the difference between income earned by residents (including income received from abroad and workers' remittances) and their consumption expenditures.
--------
Topic: Economic Policy & Debt: National accounts: Adjusted savings & income
description: Adjusted savings: gross savings (% of GNI)
